VDateInput/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VDateInput/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VDateInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VDateInput/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VDateInput/landscape.description: Puts the picker into landscape mode.

VDateInput/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VDateInput/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VDateInput/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VDateInput/append-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **append-inner** slot.

VDateInput/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VDateInput/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VDateInput/dirty.description: Manually apply the dirty state styling.

VDateInput/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VDateInput/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VDateInput/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VDateInput/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VDateInput/display-format.description: The format of the date that is displayed in the input. Can use any format [here](/features/dates/#format-options) or a custom function.

VDateInput/hide-actions.description: Hide the Cancel and OK buttons, and automatically update the value when a date is selected.

VDateInput/header-color.description: Allows you to set a different color for the header when used in conjunction with the `color` prop.

VDateInput/control-height.description: Sets the height of the controls.

VDateInput/mode-icon.description: Icon used for the mode button.

VDateInput/show-week.description: Toggles visibility of the week numbers in the body of the calendar.

VDefaultsProvider/reset.description: Reset the default values up the nested chain by {n} amount.

VDefaultsProvider/disabled.description: Turns off all calculations of new default values for improved performance in situations where defaults propagation isn't necessary.

VDefaultsProvider/root.description: Force current defaults to match the application root defaults.

VDefaultsProvider/scoped.description: Prevents the ability for default values to be inherited from parent components.

VDefaultsProvider/defaults.description: Specify new default prop values for components. Keep in mind that this will be merged with previously defined values.

VDialog/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VDialog/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VDialog/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VDialog/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VDialog/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VDialog/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VDialog/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VDialog/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VDialog/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VDialog/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VDialog/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VDialog/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VDialog/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VDialog/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VDialog/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.

VDialog/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VDialog/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

VDialog/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VDialog/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VDialog/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VDialog/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VDialog/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VDialog/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.

VDialog/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VDialog/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VDialog/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VDialog/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VDialog/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VDialog/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VDialog/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VDialog/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VDialog/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VDialog/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VDialog/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VDialog/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VDialog/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VDialog/scrollable.description: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

VDialogBottomTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VDialogBottomTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VDialogBottomTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VDialogBottomTransition/group.description: Creates a `transition-group` component. You can find more information in the [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transitiongroup).

VDialogBottomTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VDialogBottomTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VDialogTopTransition/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transition).

VDialogTopTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VDialogTopTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VDialogTopTransition/group.description: Creates a `transition-group` component. You can find more information in the [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#transitiongroup).

VDialogTopTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VDialogTopTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VDialogTransition/target.description: Sets the target element for the transition.

VDivider/length.description: Sets the dividers length. Default unit is px.

VDivider/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VDivider/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VFab/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VFab/flat.description: Removes the button box shadow. This is different than using the 'flat' variant.

VFab/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VFab/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VFab/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VFab/layout.description: If true, will effect layout dimensions based on size and position.

VFab/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VFab/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VFab/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VFab/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VFab/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VFab/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VFab/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VFab/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VFab/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VFab/offset.description: Translates the Fab up or down, depending on if location is set to **top** or **bottom**.

VFab/block.description: Expands the button to 100% of available space.

VFab/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VFab/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VFab/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VFab/readonly.description: Puts the button in a readonly state. Cannot be clicked or navigated to by keyboard.

VFab/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VFab/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VFab/appear.description: Used to control the animation of the FAB.

VFab/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VFab/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VFab/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VFab/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component. The button will become _round_.

VFab/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VFab/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VFab/app.description: If true, attaches to the closest layout and positions according to the value of **location**.

VFab/extended.description: An alternate style for the FAB that expects text.

VFab/stacked.description: Displays the button as a flex-column.

VFabTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VFabTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VFileInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VFileInput/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VFileInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VFileInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VFileInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VFileInput/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'

VFileUpload/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VFileUpload/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VFileUpload/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VFileUpload/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VFileUpload/thickness.description: Sets the dividers thickness. Default unit is px.

VFileUpload/show-size.description: Shows the size of the file.

VFileUploadItem/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VFileUploadItem/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

VFileUploadItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VFileUploadItem/nav.description: Reduces the width v-list-item takes up as well as adding a border radius.

VFileUploadItem/title.description: Generates a `v-list-item-title` component with the supplied value. Note that this overrides the native [`title`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/title) attribute, that must be set with `v-bind:title.attr` instead.

VFileUploadItem/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VFileUploadItem/value.description: The value used for selection. Obtained from [`v-list`](/api/v-list)'s `v-model:selected` when the item is selected.

VFileUploadItem/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VFileUploadItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VFileUploadItem/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VFileUploadItem/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VFileUploadItem/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

VFileUploadItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VFileUploadItem/lines.description: The line declaration specifies the minimum height of the item and can also be controlled from v-list with the same prop.

VFileUploadItem/slim.description: Reduces horizontal spacing for badges, icons, tooltips, and avatars to create a more compact visual representation.

VFileUploadItem/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VFileUploadItem/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VFileUploadItem/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VFileUploadItem/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VFileUploadItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VFileUploadItem/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VFileUploadItem/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VFileUploadItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VFileUploadItem/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VFileUploadItem/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VFileUploadItem/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VFileUploadItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control when in an **active** state or **input-value** is **true** - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors),

VFileUploadItem/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VFileUploadItem/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VFileUploadItem/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VFileUploadItem/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VFileUploadItem/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VFileUploadItem/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VFileUploadItem/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VFileUploadItem/show-size.description: Show the size of the file

VFileUploadItem/file-icon.description: The icon prepending each uploaded file. This will be a preview image if the file is an image.

VFileUploadItem/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VFileUploadItem/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VFooter/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VFooter/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VFooter/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VFooter/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VFooter/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VFooter/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VFooter/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VFooter/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VFooter/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VFooter/app.description: Determines the position of the footer. If true, the footer would be given a fixed position at the bottom of the viewport. If false, the footer is set to the bottom of the page.

VForm/disabled.description: Puts all children inputs into a disabled state.

VForm/model-value.description: The value representing the validity of the form. If the value is `null` then no validation has taken place yet, or the form has been reset. Otherwise the value will be a `boolean` that indicates if validation has passed or not.

VForm/readonly.description: Puts all children inputs into a readonly state.

VForm/fast-fail.description: Stop validation as soon as any rules fail.

VHover/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VHover/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VHover/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VIcon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VIcon/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VIcon/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VIcon/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VIcon/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VIcon/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

VIcon/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

VIcon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VIconBtn/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VIconBtn/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VIconBtn/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component.

VIconBtn/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VIconBtn/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VIconBtn/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VIconBtn/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VIconBtn/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VIconBtn/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VIconBtn/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VIconBtn/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VIconBtn/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VIconBtn/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VIconBtn/icon-color.description: Explicit color applied to the icon.

VIconBtn/active.description: When undefined (default), the component utilizes its default variant, otherwise it will use the activeVariant if active is true, or the baseVariant if active is false.

VIconBtn/rotate.description: The rotation of the icon in degrees.

VIconBtn/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VIconBtn/base-variant.description: When active is a boolean, this variant is used when active is false.

VIconBtn/hide-overlay.description: Hides overlay from being displayed when active or focused.

VIconBtn/icon-size.description: The specific size of the icon, can use named sizes.

VIconBtn/icon-sizes.description: An array of tuples that define the icon sizes for each named size.

VIconBtn/sizes.description: An array of tuples that define the button sizes for each named size.

VIconBtn/active-icon.description: When active is a boolean, this icon is used when active is true.

VIconBtn/active-variant.description: When active is a boolean, this variant is used when active is true.

VImg/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VImg/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VImg/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VImg/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VImg/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VImg/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VImg/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VImg/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VImg/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VImg/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VImg/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VImg/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

VImg/transition.description: The transition to use when switching from `lazy-src` to `src`. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VImg/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

VImg/alt.description: Alternate text for screen readers. Leave empty for decorative images.

VImg/src.type:
| string
  | { src: string; srcset: string; lazySrc: string; aspect: number }
VImg/src.description: The image URL. This prop is mandatory.

VImg/draggable.description: Controls the `draggable` behavior of the image. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/draggable).

VImg/aspect-ratio.description: Calculated as `width/height`, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be `1.7778`. Will be calculated automatically if omitted.

VImg/position.description: Applies [object-position](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-position) styles to the image and placeholder elements.

VImg/cover.description: Resizes the background image to cover the entire container.

VImg/gradient.description: The gradient to apply to the image. Only supports [linear-gradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gradient/linear-gradient) syntax, anything else should be done with classes.

VImg/lazy-src.description:
Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.  
NOTE: This prop has no effect unless either `height` or `aspect-ratio` are provided.

VImg/srcset.description: A set of alternate images to use based on device size. [Read more...](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attr-srcset).

VImg/inline.description: Display as an inline element instead of a block, also disables flex-grow.

VImg/crossorigin.description: Specify that images should be fetched with CORS enabled [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#crossorigin)

VImg/referrerpolicy.description: Define which referrer is sent when fetching the resource [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#referrerpolicy)

VInfiniteScroll/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VInfiniteScroll/mode.description: Specifies if content should load automatically when scrolling (**intersect**) or manually (**manual**).

VInfiniteScroll/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VInfiniteScroll/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VInfiniteScroll/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VInfiniteScroll/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VInfiniteScroll/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VInfiniteScroll/margin.description: Value sent to the intersection observer. Will make the observer trigger earlier, by the margin (px) value supplied.

VInfiniteScroll/side.description: Specifies the side where new content should appear. Either the **start**, **end**, or **both** sides.

VInfiniteScroll/load-more-text.description: Text shown in default load more button, when in manual mode.

VInfiniteScroll/empty-text.description: Text shown when there is no more content to load.

VInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VInput/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VInput/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VInput/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VInput/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VInput/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VInput/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VInput/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VItemGroup/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VItemGroup/selected-class.description: Configure the selected CSS class. This class will be available in `v-item` default scoped slot.

VLazy/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

VList/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VList/nav.description: An alternative styling that reduces `v-list-item` width and rounds the corners. Typically used with **[v-navigation-drawer](/components/navigation-drawers)**.

VList/activated.description: Array of ids of activated nodes.

VList/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VList/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have a **title** property, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props), a **value** property to allow selection, and a **children** property containing more item objects. Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, **item-props**, and **item-children** props.

VList/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VList/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VList/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it is in an active state.

VList/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VList/disabled.description: Puts all children inputs into a disabled state.

VList/expand-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is collapsed.

VList/collapse-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is expanded.

VList/lines.description: Designates a **minimum-height** for all children `v-list-item` components. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

VList/slim.description: Reduces horizontal spacing for badges, icons, tooltips, and avatars within slim list items to create a more compact visual representation.

VList/activatable.description: Designates whether the list items are activatable.

VList/selectable.description: Designates whether the list items are selectable.

VList/opened.description: An array containing the values of currently opened groups. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:opened`.

VList/selected.description: An array containing the values of currently selected items. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:selected`.

VList/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VList/active-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when activated.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be activated.
- **independent:** All nodes can be activated whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Activating a parent node will cause all children to be activated.

VList/select-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when selected.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be selected.
- **independent:** All nodes can be selected whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Selecting a parent node will cause all children to be selected, parent nodes will be displayed as selected if all their descendants are selected. Only leaf nodes will be added to the model.
- **trunk**: Same as classic but if all of a node's children are selected then only that node will be added to the model.

VList/open-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when expanded.
- **multiple:** Any number of groups can be open at once.
- **single:** Only one group at each level can be open, opening a group will cause others to close.
- **list:** Multiple, but all other groups will close when an item is selected.

VList/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VList/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VList/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VList/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VList/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VList/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VList/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VList/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VList/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VList/item-type.description: Designates the key on the supplied items that is used for determining the nodes type.

VList/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VList/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VList/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children.

VList/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VList/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VList/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VList/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VList/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VList/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VList/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VListGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListGroup/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VListGroup/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VListGroup/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VListGroup/expand-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is collapsed.

VListGroup/collapse-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is expanded.

VListGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VListGroup/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VListGroup/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VListGroup/fluid.description: Removes the left padding assigned for action icons from group items.

VListGroup/subgroup.description: Designate the component as nested list group.

VListImg/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListItem/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VListItem/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

VListItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListItem/nav.description: Reduces the width v-list-item takes up as well as adding a border radius.

VListItem/title.description: Generates a `v-list-item-title` component with the supplied value. Note that this overrides the native [`title`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/title) attribute, that must be set with `v-bind:title.attr` instead.

VListItem/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VListItem/value.description: The value used for selection. Obtained from [`v-list`](/api/v-list)'s `v-model:selected` when the item is selected.

VListItem/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VListItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VListItem/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VListItem/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VListItem/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

VListItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VListItem/lines.description: The line declaration specifies the minimum height of the item and can also be controlled from v-list with the same prop.

VListItem/slim.description: Reduces horizontal spacing for badges, icons, tooltips, and avatars to create a more compact visual representation.

VListItem/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VListItem/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VListItem/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VListItem/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VListItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VListItem/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VListItem/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VListItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VListItem/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VListItem/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VListItem/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VListItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control when in an **active** state or **input-value** is **true** - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors),

VListItem/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VListItem/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VListItem/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VListItem/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VListItem/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VListItem/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VListItem/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VListItem/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VListItemAction/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListItemAction/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

VListItemAction/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

VListItemMedia/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListItemMedia/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

VListItemMedia/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

VListItemSubtitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListItemTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListSubheader/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VListSubheader/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VListSubheader/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VListSubheader/inset.description: Insets the subheader without additional spacing, aligning it flush with the surrounding content.

VListSubheader/sticky.description: Sticks the header to the top of the table.

VLocaleProvider/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VLocaleProvider/fallback-locale.description: Specify a fallback locale to use when a locale is not found.

VMain/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VMain/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VMain/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VMain/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VMain/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VMain/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VMain/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VMenu/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VMenu/id.description: The unique identifier of the component.

VMenu/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VMenu/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VMenu/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VMenu/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VMenu/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VMenu/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VMenu/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component. Use `auto` to use the activator width.

VMenu/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VMenu/submenu.description: Opens with right arrow and closes on left instead of up/down. Implies `location="end"`. Directions are reversed for RTL.

VMenu/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VMenu/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VMenu/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VMenu/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VMenu/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VMenu/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VMenu/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VMenu/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VMenu/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VMenu/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VMenu/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VMenu/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click.

VMenu/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover.

VMenu/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VMenu/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked.

VMenu/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VMenu/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VMenu/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VMenu/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VMenu/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VMenu/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VMenu/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VMenu/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VMenu/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VMenu/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default. Generally not recommended except as a last resort: the default positioning algorithm should handle most scenarios better than is possible without teleporting, and you may have unexpected behavior if the menu ends up as child of its activator.

VMessages/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VMessages/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component; leaveAbsolute: boolean; group: boolean }
VMessages/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VMessages/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VMessages/active.description: Determines whether the messages are visible or not.

VNavigationDrawer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VNavigationDrawer/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VNavigationDrawer/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VNavigationDrawer/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VNavigationDrawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VNavigationDrawer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VNavigationDrawer/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VNavigationDrawer/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VNavigationDrawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNavigationDrawer/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VNavigationDrawer/persistent.description: Clicking outside or pressing **esc** key will not dismiss the dialog.

VNavigationDrawer/scrim.description: Determines whether an overlay is used when a **temporary** drawer is open. Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VNavigationDrawer/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/location.description: Controls the edge of the screen the drawer is attached to.

VNavigationDrawer/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VNavigationDrawer/image.description: Apply a specific background image to the component.

VNavigationDrawer/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VNavigationDrawer/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.

VNavigationDrawer/sticky.description: When true, the drawer will remain visible when scrolling past the top of the page.

VNavigationDrawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right).

VNavigationDrawer/disable-resize-watcher.description: Prevents the automatic opening or closing of the drawer when resized, based on whether the device is mobile or desktop.

VNavigationDrawer/disable-route-watcher.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes.

VNavigationDrawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse.

VNavigationDrawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size.

VNavigationDrawer/rail.description: Sets the component width to the **rail-width** value.

VNavigationDrawer/rail-width.description: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

VNavigationDrawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background.

VNumberInput/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VNumberInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VNumberInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VNumberInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VNumberInput/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VNumberInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VNumberInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNumberInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VNumberInput/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VNumberInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VNumberInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VNumberInput/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VNumberInput/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VNumberInput/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VNumberInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNumberInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VNumberInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VNumberInput/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VNumberInput/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VNumberInput/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VNumberInput/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VNumberInput/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VNumberInput/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VNumberInput/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VNumberInput/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VNumberInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VNumberInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VNumberInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VNumberInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VNumberInput/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VNumberInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VNumberInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VNumberInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VNumberInput/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VNumberInput/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VNumberInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VNumberInput/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VNumberInput/append-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **append-inner** slot.

VNumberInput/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VNumberInput/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VNumberInput/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VNumberInput/dirty.description: Manually apply the dirty state styling.

VNumberInput/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VNumberInput/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VNumberInput/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VNumberInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VNumberInput/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VNumberInput/max.description: Specifies the maximum allowable value for the input.

VNumberInput/min.description: Specifies the minimum allowable value for the input.

VNumberInput/step.description: Defines the interval between allowed values when the user increments or decrements the input

VNumberInput/inset.description: Applies an indentation to the dividers used in the stepper buttons.

VNumberInput/control-variant.description: The color of the control. It defaults to the value of `variant` prop.

VNumberInput/precision.description: Enforces strict precision. It is expected to be an integer value in range between `0` and `15`, or null for unrestricted.

VOtpInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VOtpInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VOtpInput/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VOtpInput/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VOtpInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VOtpInput/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VOtpInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VOtpInput/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VOtpInput/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VOtpInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VOtpInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VOtpInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VOtpInput/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VOtpInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VOtpInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VOtpInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VOtpInput/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VOtpInput/divider.description: Specifies the dividing character between items.

VOtpInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VOtpInput/autofocus.description: Automatically focuses the first input on page load

VOtpInput/focus-all.description: Puts all inputs into a focus state when any are focused

VOverlay/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VOverlay/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VOverlay/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VOverlay/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VOverlay/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VOverlay/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VOverlay/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VOverlay/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VOverlay/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VOverlay/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VOverlay/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VOverlay/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VOverlay/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VOverlay/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VOverlay/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VOverlay/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VOverlay/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VOverlay/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VOverlay/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VOverlay/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VOverlay/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VOverlay/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VOverlay/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VOverlay/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VOverlay/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VOverlay/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VOverlay/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VOverlay/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VOverlay/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VOverlay/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VOverlay/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VOverlay/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VPagination/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VPagination/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VPagination/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VPagination/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VPagination/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VPagination/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VPagination/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VPagination/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VPagination/color.description: Applies specified color to the selected page button - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPagination/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VPagination/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VPagination/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VPagination/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VPagination/next-icon.description: The icon to use for the next button.

VPagination/prev-icon.description: The icon to use for the prev button.

VPagination/total-visible.description: Specify the total visible pagination numbers.

VPagination/first-icon.description: The icon to use for the first button.

VPagination/last-icon.description: The icon to use for the last button.

VPagination/current-page-aria-label.description: Label for the currently selected page.

VPagination/first-aria-label.description: Label for the go to first button.

VPagination/last-aria-label.description: Label for the go to last button.

VPagination/ellipsis.description: Text to show between page buttons when truncating the list.

VPagination/show-first-last-page.description: Show buttons for going to first and last page.

VParallax/scale.description: The scale of the parallax image.

VPicker/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VPicker/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VPicker/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VPicker/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VPicker/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VPicker/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VPicker/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VPicker/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VPicker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VPicker/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VPicker/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VPicker/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).
