VPicker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPicker/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VPicker/divided.description: Adds a divider between the header and controls.

VPicker/landscape.description: Puts the picker into landscape mode.

VPickerTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VProgressCircular/model-value.description: The percentage value for current progress.

VProgressCircular/width.description: Sets the stroke of the circle in pixels.

VProgressCircular/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VProgressCircular/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VProgressCircular/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressCircular/size.description: Sets the diameter of the circle in pixels.

VProgressCircular/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressCircular/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown. If set to the string `'disable-shrink'` it will use a simpler animation that does not run on the main thread.

VProgressCircular/rotate.description: Rotates the circle start point in degrees.

VProgressLinear/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VProgressLinear/reverse.description: Displays reversed progress (right to left in LTR mode and left to right in RTL).

VProgressLinear/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VProgressLinear/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VProgressLinear/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VProgressLinear/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VProgressLinear/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VProgressLinear/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VProgressLinear/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VProgressLinear/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressLinear/active.description: Reduce the height to 0, hiding component.

VProgressLinear/max.description: Sets the maximum value the progress can reach.

VProgressLinear/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VProgressLinear/opacity.description: Set the opacity of the progress bar.

VProgressLinear/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown.

VProgressLinear/stream.description: An alternative style for portraying loading that works in tandem with **buffer-value**.

VProgressLinear/bg-opacity.description: Background opacity, if null it defaults to 0.3 if background color is not specified or 1 otherwise.

VProgressLinear/buffer-value.description: The percentage value for the buffer.

VProgressLinear/buffer-color.description: Sets the color of the buffer bar.

VProgressLinear/buffer-opacity.description: Set the opacity of the buffer bar.

VProgressLinear/clickable.description: Clicking on the progress track will automatically set the value.

VProgressLinear/striped.description: Adds a stripe background to the filled portion of the progress component.

VProgressLinear/rounded-bar.description: Applies a border radius to the progress bar.

VPullToRefresh/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VPullToRefresh/pull-down-threshold.description: The distance the user must pull down to trigger a refresh.

VRadio/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VRadio/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VRadio/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VRadio/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VRadio/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VRadio/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VRadio/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VRadio/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VRadio/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VRadio/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VRadio/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VRadio/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VRadio/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VRadio/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VRadio/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VRadioGroup/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VRadioGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VRadioGroup/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VRadioGroup/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VRadioGroup/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VRadioGroup/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VRadioGroup/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VRadioGroup/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VRadioGroup/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VRadioGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VRadioGroup/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VRadioGroup/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VRadioGroup/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VRadioGroup/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VRadioGroup/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VRadioGroup/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VRadioGroup/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VRadioGroup/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VRadioGroup/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VRadioGroup/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VRadioGroup/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VRadioGroup/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VRadioGroup/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VRadioGroup/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VRadioGroup/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VRadioGroup/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VRadioGroup/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VRadioGroup/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VRadioGroup/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VRadioGroup/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VRadioGroup/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VRadioGroup/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VRadioGroup/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VRangeSlider/step.description: If greater than 0, sets step interval for ticks.

VRangeSlider/thumb-color.description: Sets the thumb and thumb label color.

VRangeSlider/thumb-label.description: Show thumb label. If `true` it shows label when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows label.

VRangeSlider/thumb-size.description: Controls the size of the thumb label.

VRangeSlider/show-ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VRangeSlider/ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VRangeSlider/strict.description: Disallows dragging the ending thumb past the starting thumb and vice versa.

VRating/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared by clicking on the current value.

VRating/item-labels.description: Array of labels to display next to each item..

VResponsive/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VResponsive/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VResponsive/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VResponsive/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VResponsive/inline.description: Display as an inline element instead of a block, also disables flex-grow.

VResponsive/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

VResponsive/aspect-ratio.description: Sets a base aspect ratio, calculated as width/height. This will only set a **minimum** height, the component can still grow if it has a lot of content.

VRow/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VRow/align.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are: **start**, **center**, **end**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

VRow/align-md.description: Changes the **align-items** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

VRow/align-lg.description: Changes the **align-items** property on large and greater breakpoints.

VRow/align-xl.description: Changes the **align-items** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.

VRow/align-xxl.description: Changes the **align-items** property on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

VRow/justify-md.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

VRow/justify-lg.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on large and greater breakpoints.

VScrollYReverseTransition/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VScrollYReverseTransition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation).

VScrollYReverseTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSelect/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VSelect/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSelect/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSelect/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSelect/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSelect/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width of the select's `v-menu` content.

VSelect/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSelect/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VSelect/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSelect/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSelect/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VSelect/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VSelect/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSelect/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSelect/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSelect/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VSelect/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VSelect/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSelect/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VSelect/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSelect/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VSelect/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VSelect/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSelect/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSelect/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VSelect/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

VSelect/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VSelect/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSelect/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the field is focused and apply color.

VSelect/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VSelect/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSelect/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSelect/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSelect/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSelect/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSelect/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSelect/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'

  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'

  | 'submit eager'

VSelect/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VSelect/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VSelect/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VSelect/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSelect/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

VSelect/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

VSelect/close-text.description: Text set to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

VSelect/open-text.description: Text set to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

VSelect/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

VSelect/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

VSelect/list-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-list` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-list](/api/v-list/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VSelect/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479).

VSelect/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VSelect/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VSelect/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

VSelect/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state.

VSelect/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VSelect/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VSelect/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VSelect/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VSelect/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VSelect/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VSelect/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VSelect/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VSelect/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VSkeletonLoader/type.description: A string delimited list of skeleton components to create such as `type="text@3"` or `type="card, list-item"`. Will recursively generate a corresponding skeleton from the provided string. Also supports short-hand for multiple elements such as **article@3** and **paragraph@2** which will generate 3 _article_ skeletons and 2 _paragraph_ skeletons. Please see below for a list of available pre-defined options.

VSkeletonLoader/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSkeletonLoader/loading-text.description: aria-label for the element in a loading state.

VSkeletonLoader/boilerplate.description: Remove the loading animation from the skeleton.

VSlideGroup/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VSlideGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSlideGroup/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VSlideGroup/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VSlideGroup/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VSlideGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSlideGroup/direction.description: Switch between horizontal and vertical modes.

VSlideGroup/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VSlideGroup/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VSlideGroup/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

VSlideGroup/prev-icon.description: The prepended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/next-icon.description: The appended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VSlideGroup/center-active.description: Forces the selected component to be centered.

VSlideGroup/show-arrows.description: Change when the overflow arrow indicators are shown. By **default**, arrows *always* display on Desktop when the container is overflowing. When the container overflows on mobile, arrows are not shown by default. A **show-arrows** value of `true` allows these arrows to show on Mobile if the container overflowing. A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

VSlideGroupItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSnackbar/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VSnackbar/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VSnackbar/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VSnackbar/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VSnackbar/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VSnackbar/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSnackbar/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VSnackbar/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VSnackbar/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VSnackbar/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VSnackbar/open-on-hover.description: Activate the component when the activator is hovered.

VSnackbar/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VSnackbar/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VSnackbar/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbar/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VSnackbar/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VSnackbar/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VSnackbar/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VSnackbar/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VSnackbar/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSnackbar/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VSnackbar/vertical.description: Stacks snackbar content on top of the actions (button).

VSnackbar/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VSnackbar/multi-line.description: Gives the snackbar a larger minimum height.

VSnackbar/timer.description: Display a progress bar that counts down until the snackbar closes. Pass a string to set a custom color, otherwise uses `info`.

VSnackbar/timeout.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait until snackbar is automatically hidden.  Use `-1` to keep open indefinitely (`0` in version < 2.3 ). It is recommended for this number to be between `4000` and `10000`. Changes to this property will reset the timeout.

VSpeedDial/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default. Generally not recommended except as a last resort: the default positioning algorithm should handle most scenarios better than is possible without teleporting, and you may have unexpected behavior if the menu ends up as child of its activator.

VStepperWindowItem/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VStepperWindowItem/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method.

VStepperWindowItem/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSwitch/flat.description: Display component without elevation. Default elevation for thumb is 4dp, `flat` resets it.

VSwitch/type.description: Provides the default type for children selection controls.

VSwitch/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSwitch/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSwitch/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSwitch/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSwitch/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSwitch/multiple.description: Changes expected model to an array.

VSwitch/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSwitch/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSwitch/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSwitch/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSwitch/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSwitch/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSwitch/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSwitch/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSwitch/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSwitch/glow.description: Makes prepend/append icons full opacity when the input is focused and apply color.

VSwitch/icon-color.description: Sets the color of the prepend/append icons.

VSwitch/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSwitch/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSwitch/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSwitch/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSwitch/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VSwitch/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSwitch/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSwitch/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSwitch/loading.description: Displays circular progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - primary, secondary, success, info, warning, error) or a Boolean which uses the component color (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VSwitch/indeterminate.description: Sets an indeterminate state for the switch.

VSwitch/inset.description: Enlarge the `v-switch` track to encompass the thumb.

VSwitch/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VSwitch/defaults-target.description: The target component to provide defaults values for.

VTab/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VTab/slider-color.description: Applies specified color to the slider when active on that component - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTextarea/auto-grow.description: Automatically grow the textarea depending on amount of text.

VTextarea/max-rows.description: Specifies the maximum number of rows for **auto-grow**.

VThemeProvider/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VThemeProvider/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VThemeProvider/with-background.description: Use the current value of `$vuetify.theme.dark` as opposed to the provided one.

VTimePicker/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VTimePicker/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VTimePicker/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTimePicker/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTimePicker/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTimePicker/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTimePicker/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTimePicker/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTimePicker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VTimePicker/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VTimePicker/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VTimePicker/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VTimePicker/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTimePicker/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTimePicker/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTimePicker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTimePicker/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTimePicker/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTimePicker/scrollable.description: Allows changing hour/minute with mouse scroll.

VTimePicker/divided.description: Adds a divider between the header and controls.

VTimePicker/view-mode.description: The current view mode of thep picker.`

VTimePicker/ampm-in-title.description: Place AM/PM switch in title, not near the clock.

VTimePicker/format.description: Defines the format of a time displayed in picker. Available options are `ampm` and `24hr`.

VTimePicker/use-seconds.description: Toggles the use of seconds in picker.

VTimePicker/allowed-hours.description: Restricts which hours can be selected.

VTimePicker/allowed-minutes.description: Restricts which minutes can be selected.

VTimePicker/allowed-seconds.description: Restricts which seconds can be selected.

VTimePickerClock/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTimePickerClock/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTimePickerClock/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTimePickerClock/readonly.description: When true, the picker is in a read-only state, and users cannot modify the selected time.

VTimePickerClock/max.description: Defines the maximum time value that can be selected.

VTimePickerClock/min.description: Defines the minimum time value that can be selected.

VTimePickerClock/step.description: Defines the increments between selectable times, such as a step of 1 for every minute or a larger step for every 5 or 15 minutes.

VTimePickerClock/rotate.description: Controls rotation, specifying the degree of rotation for the clock hands.

VTimePickerClock/scrollable.description: Allows the time selection to be scrollable, enhancing user experience for devices with scroll inputs.

VTimePickerClock/displayed-value.description: Used to display a custom value on the clock.

VTimePickerClock/double.description: If set, this probably indicates a double rotation or a mode where more than one set of values (like hours and minutes) is displayed on the clock at the same time.

VTimePickerClock/format.description: Specifies the format of the displayed time, either 12-hour or 24-hour, depending on the component's setup.

VTimePickerClock/allowed-values.description: Restricts which hours can be selected.

VTimePickerControls/value.description: The current value of the timepicker.

VTimePickerControls/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTimePickerControls/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTimePickerControls/view-mode.description: The current view mode of the timepicker. Can be either `hour`, `minute`, or `second`.

VTimePickerControls/use-seconds.description: Enables the display and selection of seconds in the timepicker.

VTimePickerControls/period.description: The current period value. either `am` or `pm`.

VTimeline/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTimeline/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTimeline/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTimeline/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VTimeline/direction.description: Display timeline in a **vertical** or **horizontal** direction.

VTimeline/align.description: Places the timeline dot at the top or center of the timeline item.

VTimeline/justify.description: Places timeline line at the center or automatically on the left or right side.

VTimeline/fill-dot.description: Remove outer border of item dot, making the color fill the entire dot.

VTimeline/hide-opposite.description: Hide opposite content if it exists.

VTimeline/line-inset.description: Specifies the distance between the line and the dot of timeline items.

VTimeline/side.description: Display all timeline items on one side of the timeline, either **start** or **end**.

VTimeline/truncate-line.description: Truncate timeline directly at the **start** or **end** of the line, or on **both** ends.

VTimelineItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTimelineItem/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTimelineItem/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTimelineItem/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTimelineItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTimelineItem/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTimelineItem/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTimelineItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTimelineItem/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VTimelineItem/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VTimelineItem/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTimelineItem/icon.description: Apply a specific icon to the inside dot using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VTimelineItem/side.description: Show the item either **before** or **after** the timeline. This will override the implicit ordering of items, but will in turn be overridden by the `v-timeline` **single-side** prop.

VTimelineItem/fill-dot.description: Remove outer border of item dot, making the color fill the entire dot.

VTimelineItem/hide-opposite.description: Hide opposite content if it exists.

VTimelineItem/line-inset.description: Specifies the distance between the line and the dot of the item.

VToolbar/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VToolbar/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VToolbar/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VToolbar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

VToolbar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VToolbar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VToolbar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VToolbar/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VToolbar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VToolbar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VToolbar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VToolbar/image.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

VToolbar/collapse.description: Puts the toolbar into a collapsed state reducing its maximum width.

VToolbar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

VToolbar/extension-height.description: Specify an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

VToolbarItems/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VToolbarItems/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VToolbarTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VToolbarTitle/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VTooltip/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VTooltip/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VTooltip/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTooltip/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTooltip/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTooltip/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTooltip/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTooltip/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTooltip/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VTooltip/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTooltip/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTooltip/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VTooltip/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VTooltip/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VTooltip/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VTooltip/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VTooltip/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VTooltip/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VTooltip/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VTooltip/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VTooltip/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VTooltip/open-on-click.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator click.

VTooltip/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator hover.

VTooltip/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VTooltip/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VTooltip/close-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which menu closes (when open-on-hover prop is set to true).

VTooltip/open-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which tooltip opens (when `open-on-hover` prop is set to **true**).

VTooltip/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VTooltip/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VTooltip/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VTooltip/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VTooltip/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VTooltip/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VTooltip/id.description: HTML id attribute of the tooltip overlay. If not set, a globally unique id will be used.

VTooltip/interactive.description: When true, the tooltip will respond to pointer events, allowing you to copy text from it.

VTreeview/search.description: The search model for filtering results.

VTreeview/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTreeview/activated.description: Array of ids of activated nodes.

VTreeview/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTreeview/items.description: An array of items used to build the treeview.

VTreeview/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VTreeview/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VTreeview/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VTreeview/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VTreeview/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VTreeview/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VTreeview/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it is in an active state.

VTreeview/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTreeview/expand-icon.description: Icon used to indicate that a node can be expanded.

VTreeview/collapse-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is expanded.

VTreeview/lines.description: Designates a **minimum-height** for all children `v-list-item` components. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

VTreeview/slim.description: Reduces horizontal spacing for badges, icons, tooltips, and avatars within slim list items to create a more compact visual representation.

VTreeview/activatable.description: Allows user to mark a node as active by clicking on it.

VTreeview/selectable.description: Will render a checkbox next to each node allowing them to be selected. Additionally, the **[openOnClick](/api/v-treeview/#props-open-on-click)** property will be applied internally.

VTreeview/opened.description: An array containing the values of currently opened groups. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:opened`.

VTreeview/selected.description: An array containing the values of currently selected items. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:selected`.

VTreeview/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VTreeview/active-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when activated.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be activated.
- **independent:** All nodes can be activated whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Activating a parent node will cause all children to be activated.

VTreeview/select-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when selected.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be selected.
- **independent:** All nodes can be selected whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Selecting a parent node will cause all children to be selected, parent nodes will be displayed as selected if all their descendants are selected. Only leaf nodes will be added to the model.
- **trunk**: Same as classic but if all of a node's children are selected then only that node will be added to the model.

VTreeview/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VTreeview/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTreeview/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTreeview/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTreeview/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTreeview/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTreeview/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTreeview/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTreeview/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VTreeview/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VTreeview/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VTreeview/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children.

VTreeview/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VTreeview/return-object.description: When `true` will make `v-model`, `active.sync` and `open.sync` return the complete object instead of just the key.

VTreeview/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VTreeview/rounded.description: Provides an alternative active style for `v-treeview` node. Only visible when `activatable` is `true` and should not be used in conjunction with the `shaped` prop.

VTreeview/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTreeview/color.description: Applies specified color to the active node - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTreeview/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VTreeview/model-value.description: Allows one to control which nodes are selected. The array contains the values of currently selected items. It is equivalent to the `v-model:selected`

VTreeview/open-on-click.description: When `true` will cause nodes to be opened by clicking anywhere on it, instead of only opening by clicking on expand icon. When using this prop with `activatable` you will be unable to mark nodes with children as active.

VTreeview/open-all.description: When `true` will cause all branch nodes to be opened when component is mounted.

VTreeview/loading-icon.description: Icon used when node is in a loading state.

VTreeview/indeterminate-icon.description: Icon used when node is in an indeterminate state. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

VTreeview/selected-color.description: The color of the selection checkbox.

VTreeview/load-children.description: A function used when dynamically loading children. If this prop is set, then the supplied function will be run if expanding an item that has a `item-children` property that is an empty array. Supports returning a Promise.

VTreeviewGroup/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VTreeviewGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTreeviewGroup/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VTreeviewGroup/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VTreeviewGroup/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VTreeviewGroup/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VTreeviewGroup/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VTreeviewGroup/expand-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is collapsed.

VTreeviewGroup/collapse-icon.description: Icon to display when the list item is expanded.

VTreeviewItem/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VTreeviewItem/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

VTreeviewItem/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VTreeviewItem/nav.description: Reduces the width of v-list-item takes and adds a border radius.

VTreeviewItem/title.description: Generates a `v-list-item-title` component with the supplied value. Note that this overrides the native [`title`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/title) attribute, that must be set with `v-bind:title.attr` instead.

VTreeviewItem/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VTreeviewItem/value.description: The value used for selection. Obtained from [`v-list`](/api/v-list)'s `v-model:selected` when the item is selected.

VTreeviewItem/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VTreeviewItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

VTreeviewItem/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VTreeviewItem/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VTreeviewItem/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

VTreeviewItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VTreeviewItem/lines.description: The line declaration specifies the minimum height of the item and can also be controlled from v-list with the same prop.

VTreeviewItem/slim.description: Reduces the vertical padding or height of the v-treeview-item, making it more compact.

VTreeviewItem/border.description: Applies utility border classes to the component. To use it, you need to omit the `border-` prefix, (for example use `border-sm` as `border="sm"`).  Find a list of the built-in border classes on the [borders page](/styles/borders).

VTreeviewItem/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VTreeviewItem/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VTreeviewItem/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VTreeviewItem/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VTreeviewItem/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VTreeviewItem/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VTreeviewItem/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VTreeviewItem/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VTreeviewItem/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VTreeviewItem/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VTreeviewItem/color.description: Applies specified color to the control when in an **active** state or **input-value** is **true** - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors),

VTreeviewItem/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VTreeviewItem/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VTreeviewItem/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VTreeviewItem/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VTreeviewItem/loading.description: Places the v-treeview-item into a loading state.

VTreeviewItem/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VTreeviewItem/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VTreeviewItem/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VTreeviewItem/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VTreeviewItem/toggle-icon.description: Allows customization of the icon used to toggle the expansion and collapse of treeview branches.

VValidation/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VValidation/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VValidation/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VValidation/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VValidation/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VValidation/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VValidation/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VValidation/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VValidation/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VValidation/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

VValidation/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VVirtualScroll/items.description: The array of items to display.

VVirtualScroll/height.description: Height of the component as a css value/

VVirtualScroll/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VVirtualScroll/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VVirtualScroll/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VVirtualScroll/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VVirtualScroll/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VVirtualScroll/item-height.description: Height in pixels of each item to display.

VVirtualScroll/item-key.description: Should point to a property with a unique value for each item, if not set then item index will be used as a key which may result in unnecessary re-renders.

VVirtualScroll/renderless.description: Disables default component rendering functionality. The parent node must be [a positioned element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position#types_of_positioning), e.g. using `position: relative;`

VWindow/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VWindow/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VWindow/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VWindow/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VWindow/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VWindow/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VWindow/next-icon.description: Icon used for the "next" button if `show-arrows` is `true`.

VWindow/prev-icon.description: Icon used for the "prev" button if `show-arrows` is `true`.

VWindow/continuous.description: If `true`, window will "wrap around" from the last item to the first, and from the first item to the last.

VWindow/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

VWindow/direction.description: The transition direction when changing windows.

VWindowItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VWindowItem/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VWindowItem/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method.

VWindowItem/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VWindowItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.
